Interface ISudokuSolver

public interface ISudokuSolver

Method Summary
 int[][] getPuzzle()
          Gets the content of the puzzle as an 2 dimensional array.
 void readInPuzzle(int[][] p)
          Reads in a puzzle given as an array.

          Initializes an empty puzzle of the specified size.

          Inserts the specified value in the specified position in the puzzle.
 boolean solve()

Method Detail

getPuzzle

int[][] getPuzzle()
Gets the content of the puzzle as an 2 dimensional array.

Returns:
the soduko puzzle as an 2D array of integers. If there is inserted a value in the puzzle, then the corresponding entry in the array should have that value. If there is not inserted any value in the puzzle, the corresponding entry of the array should be 0. The puzzle has entry (0,0) in the upper left corner.

setValue

void setValue(int col,
              int row,
              int value)
Inserts the specified value in the specified position in the puzzle. Should check if the specified position in the puzzle is legal (ie. exists) and if the specified value is a legal value, and only insert the value if the parameters are legal.

Parameters:
col - the column that the value should be inserted in (starts with 0 in the leftmost column).
row - the row that the value should be inserted in (starting with 0 in the topmost row).
value - the value to insert. Note that this can be 0 to errase a value from the real puzzle.

setup

void setup(int size)
Initializes an empty puzzle of the specified size.

Parameters:
size - the size measured in blocks in a row, ie. a normal soduko will have a size of 3 (and NOT 9).

readInPuzzle

void readInPuzzle(int[][] p)
Reads in a puzzle given as an array. It should be checked if the specified array has the right dimensions (ie. is "square" witht he right size) and that the values are legal.

Parameters:
p - the puzzle that should be read in.

solve

boolean solve()
Checks if the puzzle with the current content can be solved. If so, it solves the puzzle and remembers the "result", ie. when getPuzzle is called subsequently, it will return the content of the full solution.

Returns:
true, if there exist a solution with the current content of the puzzle, false otherwise.
